newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sakura Bank says to issue 75 mln preferred shares.
newsitem.headline: Sakura Bank says to issue 75 mln preferred shares.

text.p: Sakura Bank Ltd said on Friday it had decided to issue 75 million shares of preferred stock at 2,000 yen each.
Payments should be made at the end of September, Sakura said in a statement. The bank said it hoped to strengthen its financial health through the issue.
Sakura disposed of about 950 billion yen of problem loans in the fiscal year that ended on March 31, cutting its capital adequacy ratio by 0.35 percentage points to 8.37 percent.

The Bank for International Settlements (BIS) has ruled that Japanese banks operating internationally must meet its capital ratio requirements by achieving a minimum of eight percent of capital against total risk-weighted assets.
The bank said in a statement that it was the bank's second issue of convertible preferred stock.
Merrill Lynch International, Nomura International Plc and Sakura Finance International Ltd are among the underwriters.
